intro: Gastrolobium bracteolosum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruit. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers in late summer to autumn, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
